<gallery>
Fichier:Syphilis chancre LISA.jpg|alt=The description: single, clean-bottomed, painless and indurated is not always de rigueur. Here the background is fibrinous. Any ulceration of the genitals is syphilis until proven otherwise.|Syphilitic chancre: painless ulceration opposite the frenulum of the penis.
</gallery>

question.title: What is a characteristic of a chancre, a primary symptom of syphilis?
question.description: A symptom of syphilis that can be mistaken for other conditions.

option_a.title: The chancre is always painful
option_a.description: A common misconception about the chancre.

option_c.title: The chancre is only found on the penis
option_c.description: A common misconception about the chancre's location.

option_d.title: The chancre is always accompanied by other symptoms
option_d.description: A symptom of syphilis that can be mistaken for other conditions.
